Package edu.lehigh.cse216.team_m.backend

Class DataStore

java.lang.Object
edu.lehigh.cse216.team_m.backend.DataStore
public class DataStore extends Object
DataStore provides access to a set of objects, and makes sure that each has a unique identifier that remains unique even after the object is deleted. We follow the convention that member fields of a class have names that start with a lowercase 'm' character, and are in camelCase. NB: The methods of DataStore are synchronized, since they will be used from a web framework and there may be multiple concurrent accesses to the DataStore.

  • Method Details

    • createEntry

      public int createEntry(String subject, String message)
      Add a new row to the DataStore Note: we return -1 on an error. There are many good ways to handle an error, to include throwing an exception. In robust code, returning -1 may not be the most appropriate technique, but it is sufficient for this tutorial.
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject for this newly added row
      message - The message for this row
      Returns:
      the ID of the new row, or -1 if no row was created

    • readOne

      public DataRow readOne(int id)
      Get one complete row from the DataStore using its ID to select it
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the row to select
      Returns:
      A copy of the data in the row, if it exists, or null otherwise

    • readAll

      public ArrayList<DataRowLite> readAll()
      Get all of the ids and subjects that are present in the DataStore
      Returns:
      An ArrayList with all of the data

    • updateOne

      public DataRow updateOne(int id, String subject, String message, int likes)
      Update the subject and content of a row in the DataStore
      Parameters:
      id - The Id of the row to update
      subject - The new subject for the row
      message - The new message for the row
      likes - The number of likes for the row
      Returns:
      a copy of the data in the row, if it exists, or null otherwise

    • deleteOne

      public boolean deleteOne(int id)
      Delete a row from the DataStore
      Parameters:
      id - The Id of the row to delete
      Returns:
      true if the row was deleted, false otherwise
